triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The core technique used to process verbal descriptions and convert them to simulation code.

triples.name: Simulation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes automated generation of simulation models from natural language descriptions.

triples.name: Logistics
triples.relevance: The application domain for which the framework is designed to create simulation models.

triples.name: Queueing theory
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates simulation generation for queuing systems as a key application.

triples.name: Inventory management
triples.relevance: One of the main logistics domains for which the framework generates simulation models.

triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: Language models form the foundation of the framework for converting natural language to code.

triples.name: GPT-3
triples.relevance: The specific large language model (GPT-3 Codex) used as the core technology for the framework.

triples.name: Computer-supported collaboration
triples.relevance: The framework enables human-AI collaboration for developing simulation models of logistics systems.
